instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: I'm familar with the logic boards that existed before usb C.  This data bus should be working with or without a battery? <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was replaced and the resistance of <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> both measure around 2k.  ppdcin is 20v and ppbus is 0v and I think it's because <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is missing. the battery has a charge and the data bus comes back when it is attached. this seems like a pmic issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message:
SCL/SDA lines of battery bus must have very similar reading (less than 1% difference) in diode mode to ground.
Also voltage should be 3.3V approx, w/ and w/o battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: check it with no current or with current?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message:
I hope you didn't measure diode mode with power applied.

There is big difference; denotes a problem on SDA line.
I was waiting voltage level on both lines too.

I also asked you to measure in 2 scenarios.
How do I know which values posted???
Was without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message:
scl is 3.3v with or without the battery connected
sda is 3.3v with the battery and 0.9v without the battery connected
diode mode is .449 for scl and .412 for sda

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: is it safe to measure in diode mode with the battery attached?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message:
The pull-up resistors for battery bus are connected to MLB.
No problem to measure with battery, if charger is not connected.

Remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and check again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: it was still the same reading with <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> removed but reflowed <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and now it powers up. i misplaced <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> so can i just run a wire from ground to <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: There is no relation between <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: the board works without <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>? battery won't charge properly without <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is pulled down to ground (as needed) through <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>.
<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> is only used as spike protection for battery data bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0v when the battery isn't attached
threads.message: the board is working without it but i'll be responsible and replace <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>
